name: An Taigh Osda

reviews.title: This is better than the distilleries
reviews.text: What a great little place. The food, the rooms, the welcome, the location. Paul and Joan have got this place just right..exactly what you want without being too stuffy. The food is brilliant and the selection of whiskies will keep you busy for a while. Brilliant location to explore Islay and fabulous views over the water. Only 60 seconds walk from Bruichladdich distillery.On an island where the scenery is king, this place is definitely the perfect compliment to your stay.

reviews.title: The Perfect Base From Which To Enjoy A Special Island
reviews.text: Colin and Ailein

reviews.title: One of my favorites
reviews.text: I had been waiting nearly fifteen years to visit Islay, since I became a 'friend' of Laphroaig in 1995. To celebrate my 50th birthday my wife booked a surprise trip with two nights' stay at An Taigh-Osda. The hotel was the perfect place to stay; comfortable, friendly, well appointed, with delicious food. Paul and Joan are genuinely committed to providing a five star service and they succeed.

reviews.title: Fantastic stay
reviews.text: During our stay we visited all eight working distilleries, walked along the idyllic beach at Machir Bay and enjoyed the very relaxed way of life. It was worth the wait!

reviews.title: If you go to Islay, this is the place to stay
reviews.text: Like everyone else on this site I was wowed by this place. It's a hotel, not a B&B, and the prices reflect that, but it's worth it for a great stay. I recommend getting one of the slightly more expensive rooms as they are much bigger and have a seating area which is nice if you are with friends. However, the residents lounge also works for that if you have the smaller rooms. The beds are very comfortable and the furnishings elegant. Paul and Joan are friendly, interesting and helpful hosts and the food is wonderful...not OTT but beautifully cooked and presented. The whisky selection is fine, with advice from Paul, and there's a good wine list.

reviews.title: Gem of a small hotel!
reviews.text: Well, what can we say that hasn’t already been said. This is a gem of a small hotel run with a professionalism that would grace a very good five-star hotel. Perhaps we were so pleased to be here after our previous experience (we arrived straight after a disappointing three night break in Strontian) that our critical faculties were diminished, but we really did find this place hard to fault, from the warm welcome by name on arrival to the early breakfast on departure.

reviews.title: Just ideal!
reviews.text: The greatest praise has to be reserved for the food. It was simply stunning: high quality local ingredients, simple yet interesting menus and expertly cooked food. That well known Scottish celebrity cook Gordon Ramsay would have struggled to better the quality of food here and he could have learned an enormous amount about true hospitality: all the staff were polite, efficient and unobtrusive. The owners also had a deep knowledge of the island and can give expert advice on where to go and what to do.

reviews.title: Loved it !
reviews.text: Our room was relatively small at the back of the hotel but it was well furnished, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The lounge is also small but is very comfortable and, as you would expect for Islay, has a great whisky selection. I could make one or two tiny criticisms – after all nowhere is perfect – but can’t bring myself to mention them because we were so impressed with our stay from beginning to end.

reviews.title: Good for couples
reviews.text: We spent three nights here in June and then spent the next month wondering how to find time to go back before the end of the year!

reviews.title: The best place to stay on Islay
reviews.text: We stayed in two different rooms, both with views over the bay, and loved both of them. Clean, modern, comfortable - just felt so cosy, comfortable and relaxed in both rooms. They are furnished to a very high standard. Lovely thick bathrobes were also provided.

reviews.title: Great Break
reviews.text: This is a superb location with a view to die for.Paul & Joan are splendid hosts with great knowledge of the Island.First class rooms and food of a very high standard.

reviews.title: The Perfect Get Away
reviews.text: An Taigh-Osda is a small hotel that delivers BIG. Great location, lovely rooms, fantastic owners and staff and the most amazing food.

reviews.title: Quality small hotel with a great view
reviews.text: The owner's Paul and Joan made us feel very welcome and completely at home. Our room was modern, airy and with a great view over Loch Indaal to Bowmore. Their local knowledge and genuine interest in what we were up to, sent us off down some unbeaten tracks that showed us just how beautiful a place Islay is.

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.text: Any trip to Islay will be magnificent but a stay at An Taigh-Osda makes it perfect.

reviews.title: So glad we found an taigh osda
reviews.text: We shall return.

reviews.title: Perfect hotel on perfect location
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights at the start of May. After a lot of research and also from reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to book An Taigh-Osda. What a beautiful small hotel! There is nothing about it that I can fault. It was warm, clean, cozy, spacious. The place has been very tastefully decorated and a great deal of thought has gone into the finishing touches from the individual bathrobes to the delicious biscuits on the the tea tray in the room! We stayed in 2 of the rooms during our stay (we knew at the time of booking that we would have to move after 3 nights.) Both rooms were facing the loch and both were equally lovely. Actually the room that we moved to on the 4th night was on the top floor and is very comfortable indeed. It has a huge bathroom with a free standing bath.

reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
reviews.text: The food in An Taigh-Osda has truly to be recommended! Great selection, beautiful presentation and SO delicious!!! Testament to this is the fact that wherever we went on Islay and whoever we spoke to whether locals or visitors, everyone had something great to say about it. Most people told us that we were staying in the best place on Islay and I do believe we were! I would recommend this place to anyone. Paul and Joan are great hosts. They have put a lot of work into making this place as welcoming as it is. We will definitely be back for another visit. Thanks for your tremendous hospitality.

reviews.title: Another 5 star review!
reviews.text: going by the web site www.antaighosda.co.uk you would expect a great little hotel with good Scottish food and a good place to relax and enjoy this wonderful island. That just doesn't do it justice in any way!

reviews.title: A special place
reviews.text: Think of the most luxurious room you have stayed in ...with the best views....with the best food ...with the best service...your are nearly there! What you then have to add is the special hands on care of Paul and Joan who welcome you into their home and help you relax into island life. This is why they have won awards and will undoubtably win many more.

reviews.title: The best location,the best food, and the best welcome on Islay.
reviews.text: We dream of our next visit!

description: A small private family run hotel on the island of Islay. Contemporary in style, similar to The Bonham, Edinburgh. Our kitchen utilizes the best of local produce. A fine selection of wines and the islands malt whiskeys available from our fully licensed lounge bar.
